column1: Why does michael j fox make the best milkshakes? he uses only the finest ingredients.
column3: The word fine refers both to quality (excellent) and to a monetary charge (penalty).
column4: The jeweler determined the fine of the diamond to be exceptionally high.
column5: The court imposed a fine on the company for breaking environmental laws.

column1: How can you tell if a tornado is stupid? - if it spins anti-cyclonically.
column3: Spin refers to rotation and to a deliberate attempt at presenting information in a biased manner.
column4: The children watched the top spin for hours in amazement.
column5: The politician tried to spin the story to make himself look better.

column1: What do you call someone who takes things literally? a kleptomaniac!
column3: Take can mean to grasp or acquire (physically) and to interpret (mentally).
column4: Make sure to take your umbrella if it looks like rain.
column5: I try to take all suggestions into consideration when making decisions.

column1: I cant stop making figurines of frodo its hobbit forming.
column3: Hobbit refers to the fictional character from Tolkiens works and to the idea of habit (a recurring behavior).
column4: The hobbit lived in a cozy little home in the Shire.
column5: Developing a reading habit is essential for lifelong learning.

column1: How do you tell two witches apart? you cant! you dont know which witch is which!
column3: Witch refers to a person (often a woman) with magical powers or practices and can also refer to someone who is perceived negatively.
column4: In many cultures, a witch is seen as a figure of lore and magic.
column5: She has a reputation as a witch for her sharp tongue and fierce demeanor.
